sen.j: 仁礼 景範（にれ かげのり、正字体：仁禮、天保2年2月24日 (旧暦)（1831年4月6日） - 明治33年（1900年）11月22日）は、江戸時代末期の武士、明治時代の海軍軍人。
sen.e: Kagenori NIRE (April 6, 1831-November 22, 1900) was a samurai at the end of the Edo period and a navy officer in the Meiji period.
Kagenori NIRE (April 6, 1831-November 22, 1900) was a samurai at the end of the Edo period and a navy officer in the Meiji period.
Kagenori NIRE (April 6, 1831-November 22, 1900) was a samurai at the end of the Edo period and a navy officer in the Meiji period.

sen.j: 海軍中将正二位勲一等子爵。
sen.e: He was a Vice Admiral, Shonii (Senior Second Rank) Kun Itto (the First Order of Merit), and a viscount.
He was a Vice Admiral, Shonii (Senior Second Rank) Kun Itto (the First Order of Merit), and a viscount.
He was a Vice Admiral, Shonii (Senior Second Rank) Kun Itto (the First Order of Merit), and a viscount.

sen.j: 通称は源之丞。
sen.e: He was commonly known as 'Gennojo.'
He was commonly known as 'Gennojo.'
He was commonly known as 'Gennojo.'

sen.j: 1831年、薩摩藩士の子弟として生まれる。
sen.e: In 1831, he was born a son of a retainer of the Satsuma Domain.
In 1831, he was born a son of a retainer of Satsuma Domain.
In 1831, he was born a son of a retainer of Satsuma Domain.

sen.j: 朔平門外の変では、京都守護職の会津藩が容疑者とされた田中新兵衛の寓居を急襲した際に、田中新兵衛と一緒にいた、仁礼景範も下僕の太郎ともども逮捕され連行された。
sen.e: When the Sakuhei Gate Incident took place, and the Aizu Domain, which served as Kyoto shugoshoku (Military governor of Kyoto), raided on the house of Shinbei TANAKA, a suspected mastermind of the incident, Kagenori NIRE, who met with Shinbei TANAKA, and his servant Taro were arrested and detained.

When the Sakuhei Gate Incident took place, and Aizu Domain, which served as Kyoto shugoshoku (Military governor of Kyoto), raided on the house of Shinbei TANAKA, a suspected mastermind of the incident, Kagenori NIRE, who met with Shinbei TANAKA, and his servant Taro were arrested and detained.

When the Sakuhei Gate Incident took place, and Aizu Domain, which served as Kyoto shugoshoku (Military governor of Kyoto), raided on the house of Shinbei TANAKA, a suspected mastermind of the incident, Kagenori NIRE, who met with Shinbei TANAKA, and his servant Taro were arrested and detained.

sen.j: 後に容疑は晴れて、無罪放免となった。
sen.e: His charge was cleared later, and he was acquitted.
His charge was cleared later, and he was acquitted.
His charge was cleared later, and he was acquitted.

sen.j: 同年の薩英戦争に参加。
sen.e: He fought the Anglo-Satsuma War of the same year.
He fought the Anglo-Satsuma War of the same year.
He fought the Anglo-Satsuma War of the same year.

sen.j: 慶応3年（1867年）に藩命によりアメリカ合衆国に留学。
sen.e: In 1867, he was dispatched to the United States to study there, upon the decree of the lord of the domain.
In 1867, he was dispatched to the United States to study there, upon the decree of the lord of the domain.
In 1867, he was dispatched to the United States to study there, upon the decree of the lord of the domain.

sen.j: 1872年、海軍に出仕して海軍少佐。
sen.e: In 1872, he joined the Minister of the Navy and was assigned to a major.
In 1872, he joined the Minister of the Navy and was assigned to a major.
In 1872, he joined the Minister of the Navy and was assigned to a major.

sen.j: のち、海軍兵学校 (日本)校長、東海鎮守府長官、中艦隊司令官、軍事部長など。
sen.e: Later, he held various naval posts such as the principal of the Navy Academy, the Commander-in-chief of the Tokai Chinjuzu (Defense Headquarters), the commander of the middle-level fleets, and the director of the Military Affairs Bureau.

Later, he held various naval posts such as the principal of the Navy Academy, the Commander-in-chief of the Tokai Chinjuzu (Defense Headquarters), the commander of the middle-level fleets, and the director of the Military Affairs Bureau.

Later, he held various naval posts such as the principal of the Navy Academy, the Commander-in-chief of the Tokai Chinjuzu (Defense Headquarters), the commander of the middle-level fleets, and the director of the Military Affairs Bureau.

sen.j: 1885年、海軍中将。
sen.e: In 1885, he became a vice admiral.
In 1885, he became a vice admiral.
In 1885, he became a vice admiral.

sen.j: 1886年より参謀本部次長、海軍参謀本部長、横須賀鎮守府長官、海軍大学校長などを歴任。
sen.e: From 1886, he held various naval posts such as the vice-chief of the Staff Headquarters, the head of the Navy Staff Headquarters, the Commander-in-chief of the Yokosuka Chinjufu, and the principal of the Naval Staff College.

From 1886, he held various naval posts such as the vice-chief of the Staff Headquarters, the head of the Navy Staff Headquarters, the Commander-in-chief of the Yokosuka Chinjufu, and the principal of the Naval Staff College.

From 1886, he held various naval posts such as the vice-chief of the Staff Headquarters, the head of the Navy Staff Headquarters, the Commander-in-chief of the Yokosuka Chinjufu, and the principal of the Naval Staff College.

sen.j: 1892年、第2次伊藤内閣の海軍大臣。
sen.e: In 1892, he was assigned to Minister of the Navy by the Second Ito Cabinet.
In 1892, he was assigned to Minister of the Navy by the Second Ito Cabinet.
In 1892, he was assigned to Minister of the Navy by the Second Ito Cabinet.

sen.j: 海軍備の充実に力を注いだ。
sen.e: He devoted himself to the buildup of Navy armaments.
He devoted himself to the buildup of Navy armaments.
He devoted himself to the buildup of Navy armaments.

sen.j: 海軍の軍令権を陸軍の参謀本部からの独立に尽力した。
sen.e: He tried hard to transfer military command right from the Army Staff Headquarters to the Navy.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He tried hard to transfer military command right from the Army Staff Headquarters to the Navy.
He tried hard to transfer military command right from the Army Staff Headquarters to the Navy.

sen.j: 1893年に軍令部が設置されるが、結局陸軍の反対により頓挫した。
sen.e: In 1893, the Military Command section was set up, but it was abolished soon afterwards due to objections from the Army.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In 1893, the Military Command section was set up, but it was abolished soon afterwards due to objections from the Army.
In 1893, the Military Command section was set up, but it was abolished soon afterwards due to objections from the Army.

sen.j: さらに民党や文官側より、海軍行革に不熱心との批判を受けて辞意を表明。
sen.e: Facing accusations by political parties and civil officers of his lack of passion for Navy reforms, Kagenori announced his resignation.
Facing accusations by political parties and civil officers of his lack of passion for Navy reforms, Kagenori announced his resignation.
Facing accusations by political parties and civil officers of his lack of passion for Navy reforms, Kagenori announced his resignation.

sen.j: 伊藤博文は先の和協詔勅において、政府の公約であった海軍行革の推進と野党の国民協会_(日本)の会頭（党首）・西郷従道の引抜きを図るために辞任を認めた。
sen.e: His resignation was accepted by Hirobumi ITO, who wanted to pursue Navy reforms, a policy pledge at the preceding Imperial decree, and tried to headhunt Tsugumichi SAIGO, kaito (party leader) of the opposite Nation Association.
sen.cmt: 国民協会」定訳不明 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: His resignation was accepted by Hirobumi ITO, who wanted to pursue Navy reforms, a policy pledge at the preceding Imperial decree, and tried to headhunt Tsugumichi SAIGO, kaito (party leader) of the opposite Nation Association.

His resignation was accepted by Hirobumi ITO, who wanted to pursue Navy reforms, a policy pledge at the preceding Imperial decree, and tried to headhunt Tsugumichi SAIGO, kaito (party leader) of the opposite Nation Association.

sen.j: 仁礼は予備役編入となった。
sen.e: NIRE was transferred to the squads of reserved soldiers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: NIRE was transferred to the squads of reserved soldiers.
NIRE was transferred to the squads of reserved soldiers.

sen.j: 1893年、枢密顧問官。
sen.e: In 1893, he was assigned to a privy councilor.
In 1893, he was assigned to a privy councilor.
In 1893, he was assigned to a privy councilor.

sen.j: 1896年、後備役。
sen.e: In 1896, he was transferred to the club of veterans.
In 1896, he was transferred to the club of veterans.
In 1896, he was transferred to the club of veterans.

sen.j: 享年69。
sen.e: He died at the age of 69.
He died at the age of 69.
He died at the age of 69.

tit.e: Court Rank and Bestowal of Order
Court Rank and Bestowal of Order
Court Rank and Bestowal of Order

sen.j: 1893年6月29日、勲一等瑞宝章。
sen.e: On June 29, 1893, he was conferred the Grand Cordon of the Order of the Sacred Treasure
On June 29, 1893, he was conferred the Grand Cordon of the Order of the Sacred Treasure
On June 29, 1893, he was conferred the Grand Cordon of the Order of the Sacred Treasure
On July 7, 1884, he was created viscount.
On July 7, 1884, he was created viscount.
On July 7, 1884, he was created viscount.

sen.j: 1900年11月21日、勲一等旭日大綬章。
sen.e: On November 21, 1900, he was conferred the Grand Cordon of the Order of the Rising Sun.
On November 21, 1900, he was conferred the Grand Cordon of the Order of the Rising Sun.
On November 21, 1900, he was conferred the Grand Cordon of the Order of the Rising Sun.

sen.j: 三男の仁礼景雄は昆虫学者。
sen.e: His third son, Kageo NIRE, was an entomologist.
His third son, Kageo NIRE, was an entomologist.
His third son, Kageo NIRE, was an entomologist.

sen.j: 娘の春子は内閣総理大臣斎藤実に嫁いだ。
sen.e: His daughter Haruko married to Prime Minister Makoto Saito.
His daughter Haruko married Prime Minister Makoto Saito.
His daughter Haruko married Prime Minister Makoto Saito.
